Puppy
Nutrition: Ensure them is on a balanced diet suitable for growth and development. 
Socialization: Expose them to various environments, people, and animals to help them become well-adjusted adults. 
Training: Start basic obedience training and housebreaking early. 
Healthcare: Regular vaccinations, deworming, and flea/tick prevention are crucial. 
Exercise: Provide controlled exercise appropriate for their age and breed. 

Junior
Continued Training: Build on basic obedience and introduce more advanced commands. 
Nutrition: Transition to an adult diet, if appropriate for the breed. 
Exercise: Increase physical activity gradually as the puppy grows. 
Mental Stimulation: Provide puzzles, games, and toys to keep their mind engaged. 
Health Check-ups: Regular vet check-ups to monitor growth and development.

Adult
Nutrition: Maintain a balanced diet appropriate for their age, size, and activity level. 
Exercise: Provide regular exercise to keep them fit and mentally stimulated. 
Dental Care: Start regular dental care routines to prevent dental issues. 
Preventive Healthcare: Keep up with vaccinations, parasite prevention, and annual check-ups. 
Weight Management: Monitor their weight and adjust diet and exercise accordingly.
